titles: Whyte dyed black. Or A discouery of many most foule blemishes, impostures, and deceiptes, which D. Whyte haith practysed in his book entituled The way to the true Church Deuyded into 3 sortes Corruptions, or deprauations. Lyes. Impertinencies, or absurd reasoninges. Writen by T.W. p. And dedicated to the Vniuersity of Cambridge. Cum priuilegio.
author: Worthington, Thomas, 1549-1627.
notes: A reply to the work by John White.
The words "Corruptions .. reasoninges." are bracketed together on the title page.
Place of publication and identification of printer conjectured by STC.
Reproduction of the original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
keywords: White, John, 1570-1615. --  Way to the true Church --  Controversial literature --  Early works to 1800.
Catholic Church --  Apologetic works --  Early works to 1800.
